hero.description: Computer Engineer focused on software development.

aboutMe.description1: I am a Computer Engineering student focused on software development. My main motivation is to help through technology, and I would love to take part in projects in the healthcare, education, or any other sector aimed at improving people’s lives.
aboutMe.description2: I am a very curious and proactive person; whenever I can, I take part in contests, events, and hackathons, where I meet new people, learn, and work in teams. I believe this is one of the best ways to complement my education, and it is something I truly enjoy.
aboutMe.description3: I have worked with a variety of technologies, from mobile development with Kotlin and React Native to programming in C. I learn quickly, and currently the language I feel most comfortable with is Java, which I usually combine with Spring Boot and React.
aboutMe.description4: Although I am at the beginning of my professional career, I believe my commitment and eagerness to grow as a developer allow me to contribute value to any project and continue building meaningful solutions through technology.

roomsy.title: Roomsy
roomsy.desc: Web application to manage tasks and responsibilities in shared apartments.
roomsy.back:
- Learned how to develop a REST API using Spring Boot following best practices. 
- Implemented a large part of the frontend, creating a simple and intuitive interface that consumes the API.
roomsy.alt: Screenshot of the Roomsy web application

greendots.title: GreenDots
greendots.desc: Mobile application to discover and evaluate sustainable businesses based on their contribution to the SDGs.
greendots.back:
- Responsible for the mobile application, including UI design and navigation. 
- Presented the project alongside my teammates at an international event (EIXE 2025).
greendots.alt: Screenshots of the GreenDots mobile application

pickture.title: Pickture
pickture.desc: Chrome web extension that identifies clothing items in images and displays similar alternatives.
pickture.back:
- Created and presented a functional MVP in just 36 hours with a team of three people. 
- Learned new technologies in a short time frame (browser extensions, IndexedDB, Visual Search API).
pickture.alt: Screenshot of the Pickture extension in action
